member.name: T:POSLink2.Const.TransType
member.summary: Transaction type.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.UnKnown
member.summary: Ask user to select transaction type

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Sale
member.summary:
Authorizes the funds on the card and flags the transaction to be captured for settlement at the next settlement time.
Please use Sale when using Redeem.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Return
member.summary: Returns funds to the card open to buy.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Auth
member.summary: Verify/Authorize a payment.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.PostAuth
member.summary: Completes an Authorization Only transaction.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.ForceAuth
member.summary: Forces a transaction into an open batch. Typically used for voice authorizations.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Adjust
member.summary: Used for additional charges or gratuity. Typically used for tip adjustment.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Withdrawal
member.summary: Used to take money from bank.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Activate
member.summary: Activates a payment card. Typically used for gift card activation.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Issue
member.summary: Used to add value to an account, if the card is in inventory (new or recycle) then it will activate the card and add a new account. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Reload
member.summary: Adds value to a card account. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.CashOut
member.summary: Used to remove the remaining balance from the Card. And the account balance will be zero. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates an active card account. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Replace
member.summary: Used to transfer balance from one stored value account to another, this is typically to replace a lost or stolen account with a new one or to consolidate two or more accounts into a single account. After a transfer has completed, the source account is closed/deactivated and can no longer be used. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Merge
member.summary: The same usage as Replace.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.ReportLost
member.summary: Used to change the status of an active gift card that has been reported lost or stolen. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Void
member.summary: Used to cancel a prior authorization in the current open batch. The original transaction must be a sale, return, auth, post auth, forced and withdrawal.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidSale
member.summary: Void sale.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidReturn
member.summary: Void return.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidAuth
member.summary: Void auth.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidPostAuth
member.summary: Void post auth.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidForceAuth
member.summary: Void force auth.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.VoidWithdrawal
member.summary: Void withdrawal.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Inquiry
member.summary: Used to retrieve the balance on the card. Typically used to obtain the balance on a food stamp card or gift card.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Verify
member.summary: Used to determine if an account is available to use or to verify cardholder information.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Reactivate
member.summary: Used to activate a card that has been deactivated. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.ForcedIssue
member.summary: Used to issue a card when the approved code was received from the processor via a phone call or other means. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.ForcedAdd
member.summary: Used to add value to card when the approved code was received from the processor via a phone call or other means. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Unload
member.summary: Used to decrease value to a card account, and we should put the amount we want to decrease in the amount field. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Renew
member.summary: The same usage as Reactivate.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.GetConvertDetail
member.summary: Used to get balance from other gift system by this command. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Convert
member.summary: Used to transfer the balance get by GetConvertDetail to the new card. So before call this transaction type, the GetConvertDetail must be called first. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Tokenize
member.summary: Used to request a token which represents a card number, the token is generated randomly by the host.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.IncrementalAuth
member.summary: This is used to increase the auth amount.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.BalanceWithLock
member.summary: Used to lock the requested amount up to the current available balance for a period time. One or more locks can be active on a Prepaid Closed Loop card at one time. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.RedemptionWithLock
member.summary: This transaction is performed after a Balance Lock transaction to complete the purchase on a Prepaid Closed Loop card and unlock any remaining balance from the Balance transaction. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Rewards
member.summary: Used when an account holder makes a payment using a payment from other than a stored value account, the account holder may present their stored value account to earn points or other loyalty rewards, which would be added to their account. Typically used for gift cards.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Reenter
member.summary: Used when a debit/EBT was deleted out of the terminal, the merchant can use this transaction type to get paid again. Now for TSYS only.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.TransactionAdjustment
member.summary: Used to enables a merchant to modify a transaction amount and mark the transaction for settlement. Now for TransIT only.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Transfer
member.summary: To transfer or disburse funds from one account to another.

member.name: F:POSLink2.Const.TransType.Reversal
member.summary: Used for partial auth reversal, not all the hosts support this feature.

member.summary:

2: CheckBox. It allows the user to choose multiple entities of a predefined set of options, and the API is returned upon key press.
"CANCEL" - API return abort.
"CLEAR" will clear the CheckBox selection
"ACCEPT" - API return accept

member.name: P:POSLink2.Form.ShowItemReq.ItemDetail
member.summary:
Support more than one item. Please use SetItemDetail method to set this.
Please note:
1: If the items in one request lager than the capability of screen can display, it only displays the latter items.
2: It should be empty when line item action is delete.
Attribute: ans...2048

member.name: P:POSLink2.Form.ShowItemReq.LineItemAction
member.summary:
Line item action.
0: add(default value)
1: update
2: delete
Attribute: ans1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Form.ShowItemReq.ItemIndex
member.summary:
Use to reference to a line when added. A line can be updated or deleted using this index as reference.
Multiple lines can be added/updated/deleted at once using a single command. Each index is separated with a vertical bar ("|") as separator. For example: "1|2|5" (This will affect lines with index 1, 2 and 5).
If an Item Index is specified when the first item is added, Indexed Mode will be activated. In Indexed Mode, each time an item is added, an Item Index must be provided otherwise an error will be returned. This allows lines to be updated or deleted.
If an Item Index is not specified when the first item is added, Non-Indexed Mode will be activated. In Non-Indexed Mode, Item Index will be ignored. Lines cannot be updated or deleted.
Attribute: ans...256

member.summary:
Data Encryption flag.
0: not encrypted (default)
1: DUKPT Triple DES Key with CBC mode
2: DUKPT Triple DES Key with ECB mode
3: DES/TDES method (Depends on the Key length: TDES for 24 bytes key, DES for 8/16 bytes key).
4: Voltage E2EE.
5: AES CBC DUKPT
6: AES ECB DUKPT
The application will convert it from hexadecimal binary array into an ASCII string. For example, the 3 bytes binary array 0x1a 0x23 0xd4 can be converted into "1a23d4".
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.FullIntegration.AuthorizeCardRsp.EmvTlvData
member.summary:
EMV TLV data will be returned in consecutive TLV format data based on the Tag List filed in the request message.
Please see EMV Tags for Response of Authorize Card in Reference.
All the EMV TLV data shall be expanded to double length.
e.g. AID (A0 00 00 00 04 10 10): "4F07A0000000041010", Cardholder Name ("JACK"): "5F20044A41434B".
The following sensitive tags will NOT be included:
0x56: track 1 data
0x57: track 2 equivalent data
0x5A: PAN
0x9F1F: track1 discretionary data
0x9F6B: track 2 data(MasterCard Only)

member.summary:
Indicate the below transaction result after 2nd GAC:

Indicate the below transaction result for partial EMV only:

3: partial EMV decline
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.FullIntegration.CompleteOnlineEmvRsp.EmvTlvData
member.summary:
EMV TLV data will be returned in consecutive TLV format data based on the Tag List filed in the request message.
Please see EMV Tags for Response of Authorize Card in Reference.
All the EMV TLV data shall be expanded to double length.
e.g. AID (A0 00 00 00 04 10 10): "4F07A0000000041010", Cardholder Name ("JACK"): "5F20044A41434B".
The following sensitive tags will NOT be included:
0x56: track 1 data
0x57: track 2 equivalent data
0x5A: PAN
0x9F1F: track1 discretionary data
0x9F6B: track 2 data(MasterCard Only)
0x9F20: track 2 discretionary data
Attribute: ans...1024

member.summary:
Issuer script results, HEX format.
Attribute: an...512

member.name: P:POSLink2.Manage.SetSafParametersReq.CeilingAmountPerCardType
member.summary:
Once this amount is reached it will not accept any SAF record.
Separated by Card Type with space in the card type sequence of "Visa MasterCard AMEX Diners Discover JCB enRoute VisaFleet MasterCardFleet FleetOne Fleetwide Fuleman Gascard Voyarger WrightExpress Extended(others)", i.e. "2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000".
1 exception that value of "2000" without any spaces means taking 2000 as unified ceiling amount for each card type.
Default as empty which means ceiling amount validation will not be started during SAF.
Attribute: ans...64

member.name: P:POSLink2.Manage.SetSafParametersReq.HaloPerCardType
member.summary:
Once this amount per trans is reached it will not accept any SAF record.
Separated by Card Type with space in the card type sequence of "Visa MasterCard AMEX Diners Discover JCB enRoute VisaFleet MasterCardFleet FleetOne Fleetwide Fuleman Gascard Voyarger WrightExpress Extended(others)", i.e. "2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000 2000".
1 exception that value of "2000" without any spaces means taking 2000 as unified HALO amount for each card type.
Default as empty which means HALO amount validation will not be started during SAF.
Attribute: ans...64

member.summary: MAC calculation request.

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.InputData
member.summary:
The data used for MAC Calculation.
The data can be divided into several parts by vertical bar('|'). Use 'Encryption Bitmap' to indicate which parts is encrypted.
Terminal will remove the vertical bars ('|') and decrypt the cipher text, then MAC will be calculated using the decrypted data.
The data is represented in hexadecimal. For example: 3031|4a4b|6061.
Attribute: ans...4000

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.EncryptionBitmap
member.summary:
Indicate which parts of input data are encrypted.
0: Plaintext
1: Ciphertext
For example: if input data contain 5 parts. 00101 means the third and the fifth part are ciphertext. Default is 0, means this part is plaintext.
Attribute: var

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.MacKeySlot
member.summary:
Key Index in PED: range is [1, 99].
Attribute: n...2

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.MacWorkMode
member.summary:
MAC calculation mode:
0: ANSI X9.9. (default)
1: Hypercom Fast Mode.
2: ANSI X9.19.
Attribute: var

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.EncryptionKeySlot
member.summary:
The key slot used to encrypt input data parts. The key can't be DUKPT key.
Attribute: n...3

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.PaddingChar
member.summary:
This is used to indicate what value had been padded on data when encryption. Terminal will remove the padding chars first when calculate MAC.
0: padding 0x00.
F: padding 0xFF.
If this field is empty, terminal won’t remove the padding chars.
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.MacKeyType
member.summary:
The type of the key which is used to calculate MAC value.
0: TAK
1: DUKPT key
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.KsnFlag
member.summary:
Indicate whether to increase KSN, when MAC key type is 1(DUKPT Key).
0: Not increase(default).
1: Increase.
Attribute: n1

member.name: M:POSLink2.Ped.MacCalculationReq.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a newly created MacCalculationReq object.

member.name: T:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq
member.summary: Session key injection request.

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.SourceKeyType
member.summary:
Reserve. Must set to 1 (Terminal Master Key).
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.SourceKeyIndex
member.summary:
The source key index should be [1, 99].
Attribute: n...2

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.DestinationKeyType
member.summary:
Destination key type.
0: TPK(Terminal PIN Key)
1: TAK(Terminal MAC Key)
2: TDK(Terminal DES Key)
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.DestinationKeyIndex
member.summary:
The destination key index should be [1, 99].
Attribute: n...2

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.DestinationKeyValue
member.summary:
The destination key is the cipher text which encrypted by the source key in the mode of DES/TDES ECB.
Valid key length is 8, 16, 24.
Key data must be in ASCII format. For example, the 8 bytes binary array "\x11\x22\x33\x44\x55\x66\x77\x88" can be converted into "1122334455667788".
Attribute: an...48

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.CheckMode
member.summary:
Check Mode:
0: No KCV check.
1: Perform DES/TDES encryption on 8 bytes 0x00, and use first 4 bytes as KCV.
Attribute: n1

member.name: P:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.CheckBuffer
member.summary:
If check mode = 0, PED won't check the buffer (KCV).
If check mode = 1, the buffer(KCV) length should be 4 bytes.
The data must be in ASCII format. For example, the 4 bytes binary array "\x11\x22\x33\x44" can be converted into "11223344".
Attribute: an...8

member.name: M:POSLink2.Ped.SessionKeyInjectionReq.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a newly created SessionKeyInjectionReq object.

member.summary: Retrieve the transaction detail.

member.name: M:POSLink2.Report.Report.LocalFailedReport(POSLink2.Report.LocalFailedReportRsp@)
member.summary:
Whenever a Settlement is run, there is the possibility that some of the transactions will fail during settlement. Those transactions are saved and their details can be retrieved using this message so that the merchant can directly settle the outstanding transactions with the card processor. If the record has reported, it will not be reported again.
It depends on host.

member.name: T:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq
member.summary: Request Amount Information.

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.TransactionAmount
member.summary:
The base amount, the format is $$$$$$CC except LOYALTY, if the transaction is Loyalty, this field is the points. if this field is NULL, terminal will prompt dialog to enter the amount.
If the terminal is under demo mode, running transactions with special amount will trigger special results. Please refer to POSLink - Reference - Special Amount in Demo Mode for more details.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.TipAmount
member.summary:
The tip amount, $$$$$$CC.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.CashBackAmount
member.summary:
The cash back amount, $$$$$$CC, if the field is NULL, and the switch on terminal turn on, terminal will prompt dialog to enter it.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.MerchantFee
member.summary:
The merchant surcharge fee for DEBIT/EBT or CREDIT surcharge fee, $$$$$$CC. If the setting on terminal of "merchant fee" is 0, this field must be NULL or 0. If the setting on terminal of "merchant fee" is not 0, this field can be present or NULL, if the value is NULL, terminal will use the default value in terminal. only Debit sale and EBT cash benefit sale support it.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.TaxAmount
member.summary:
The tax amount, $$$$$$CC, if the field is NULL, and terminal supports commercial card, terminal will prompt dialog to enter it. it included in transaction amount.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.FuelAmount
member.summary:
The fuel amount. Especially for Fleet Trans. Included in the Transaction Amount.
Attribute: n...8

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.AmountReq.ServiceFee
member.summary:

member.name: T:POSLink2.Util.VasRsp
member.summary: Response VAS Information.

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.VasRsp.VasCode
member.summary:
VAS response code.
200: VAS OK.
201: VAS OSE error.
202: VAS get data command error.
203: VAS issue, need to start payment.
204: The app version of mobile is too low.
205: In VAS mode, mobile capabilities: Skip Loyalty Protocol.
206: In dual mode, mobile capabilities: Skip Loyalty Protocol and No Payment Data Forthcoming.
207: In single mode, Mobile Capabilities: Skip Loyalty Protocol and No Payment Data Forthcoming.
208: 6A83-VAS Data not found (iPhone without the pkpass).
209: 6287-VAS Data not active (without fingerprint auth).
210: 6984-User Intervention Required on mobile device (a special iOS version will trigger this issue, maybe is without auth, too).
211: VAS parameter error, The merchant ID is null.
212: VAS get key error, Error when get key from key file.
213: VAS Data Decryption Error. Data can't be decrypted by the current key.
255: Unknown error.
Attribute: n3

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.VasRsp.VasData
member.summary:
Tokens returned from card.
Attribute: var

member.name: P:POSLink2.Util.VasRsp.NdefData
member.summary:
Google Smart Tap response data in format of NEDF, the message will be encoded with Base64.
Attribute: ans...1024
